sections.title: What date do you expect your business to start being liable for duty on biofuels and other fuel substitutes?
sections.shortName: Date you expect to start being liable for duty

fields.label: What date do you expect your business to start being liable for duty on biofuels and other fuel substitutes?
What is the start point for the duty?
fields.infoText:
You start being liable for duty when a biofuel or other fuel substitute is first, sent out from your premises, set aside, or used as a motor fuel. 

A biofuel or fuel substitute is 'set aside' when the decision has been made to use it as a motor fuel. For example, when its container is labelled as a motor fuel.

sections.title: You can not register your business for duty on biofuels and other fuel substitutes at this time
sections.description: This is because you expect to produce or use a total of less than 2,500 litres of biofuels and other fuel substitutes in the next 12 months. This means that you are an exempt producer and are not currently liable for duty.

fields.infoText:
You must come back and register if you produce or use a total of 2,500 litres or more in a 12 month period, or if you later expect to produce or use this amount within the next 12
months.

You can find out more about being an exempt producer in  [Excise Notice 179e: biofuels and other fuel substitutes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/excise-notice-179e-biofuels-and-other-fuel-substitutes/excise-notice-179e-biofuels-and-other-fuel-substitutes#exempt-producers-users) on GOV.UK.
You'll need to exit this service.

fields.infoText:
By submitting this registration you confirm that the information you have provided is true and complete. 

If you do not give complete and accurate information, HMRC may charge a financial penalty or even prosecute you.
This is your last opportunity to print or save a PDF copy of your submitted registration.

To complete this registration you must provide us with more details about your premises using an additional form.

The form you need to use depends on the type of business you are registering:

* if the business is a limited company or limited liability partnership (LLP) you'll need to complete and send form [EX103A Excise entry: incorporated company](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/excise-entry-incorporated-company-ex103a) for each of your premises

* if the business is a sole trader or partnership you'll need to complete and send form [EX103 Excise entry: private trader](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/excise-entry-private-trader-ex103) for each of your premises

HMRC will then send you a questionnaire, which you must complete and return to us.
##If the business is a partnership or limited liability partnership (LLP)
You must also inform HMRC of this, so that we can ask you for details about the partnership. You'll need to email HMRC on, enquiries.eeitts@hmrc.gov.uk to tell us.
##If you want to apply to defer duty payments

You'll need to check [Excise Notice 179e: biofuels and other fuel substitutes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/excise-notice-179e-biofuels-and-other-fuel-substitutes/excise-notice-179e-biofuels-and-other-fuel-substitutes#biofuel-producers-obligations) on GOV.UK for details about how to apply for deferment.

Returns will need to be submitted quarterly if  you expect to produce or use a total of less than 450,000 litres of biofuels and other fuel substitutes in the next year. Businesses that expect to produce or use 450,000 litres or more will need to submit returns monthly.
